stages.name: Launch
stages.text: MAVEN launched from Cape Canaveral aboard an Atlas V (401) to begin a dedicated study of how Mars’ upper atmosphere interacts with the Sun and solar wind, and how atmospheric gases escape to space.

media.caption: Artist’s concept of the MAVEN spacecraft (PIA17487).

stages.name: Mars orbit insertion
stages.text: MAVEN successfully entered orbit around Mars after a ~33-minute main-engine burn, beginning its orbital commissioning and transition toward its science mapping orbit.

stages.name: Comet Siding Spring close pass
stages.text: Comet C/2013 A1 (Siding Spring) made a very close pass by Mars, allowing MAVEN and other Mars missions to observe how the comet’s material interacted with the Martian environment.

media.caption: Ultraviolet image of Comet Siding Spring showing its large hydrogen coma (PIA18865).

stages.name: Mission extended
stages.text: Following strong scientific return, MAVEN received mission extensions beyond its prime mission to continue long-term monitoring of Mars’ upper atmosphere and space weather effects.
